thread.title: NBA Skills Challenge 2017: Isaiah Thomas and Joel Embiid will headline
thread.title_full: NBA Skills Challenge 2017: Isaiah Thomas and Joel Embiid will headline

author: SB Nation NBA Staff
title: NBA Skills Challenge 2017: Isaiah Thomas and Joel Embiid will headline
text:
Skills challenge will follow last year’s bigs vs. guards format.
The NBA has announced the participants for the 2017 Taco Bell Skills Challenge, and after last season’s shocker, this year’s competition has big shoes to fill.
Last season, the league switched to a bigs vs. guards format, where T’Wolves center Karl-Anthony Towns recharged the pass, dribble and shoot event by out-gunning All-Star guard Isaiah Thomas in the final round. Both players completed the chest pass on the first attempt, but Towns was able to make his three-pointer on the fourth try before IT4 could get his shot off.
This year we will have a new champ from the group of Joel Embiid , Kristaps Porzingis , Gordon Hawyard, Anthony Davis, and John Wall who will make his third appearance. The challenge will feature four guards and four forwards which was introduced in 2016.
The Skills Challenge is part of an All-Star Saturday night that also includes the Three-Point Contest and the Verizon Slam Dunk Contest. Last year, it featured (Thomas, C.J. McCollum , Jordan Clarkson and Emmanuel Mudiay ) and (Towns, Draymond Green , Anthony Davis and DeMarcus Cousins).
Rockets guard Patrick Beverley won in 2015, while Damian Lillard and Trey Burke both won in 2014.
